result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Xavier Emmanuel Melendez De Jesus

defendant.name: Melendez De Jesus, Xavier Emmanuel

records.addlTxt: 1:06 PM Defendant Xavier Emmanuel Melendez De Jesus in court.  Attorney Blake Duren in court for Xavier Emmanuel Melendez De Jesus.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Delain in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Duren has received discovery and an offer from the State but does not believe matter will resolve.  Enters not guilty plea.  Court enters Not Guilty Plea, to be set for trial.  DE confirms address.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Court reviews financial information.  Court finds conditionally indigent.   Court appoints Attorney Blake Duren, 158 E. Main Street, Reedsburg, WI 53959 (608) 415-9066 @$100/hr and reimbursement @ $150.00/month commencing September 15, 2022, directly to the Sauk Co. Clerk of Courts.

2:51 PM Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Xavier Emmanuel Melendez De Jesus in court. Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised rights to an attorney.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  State requests bond continue.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact with E.B.H.M.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Return date scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
